tic & travis - an overview

Patrick Schratz, Kirill Müller

Source: vignettes/tic-travis.Rmd
tic-travis.Rmd

Most of the setup work that needs to be done for Travis CI is handled by the travis package. These are tasks like enabling the repo in travis-ci.org, setting up SSH deployment keys for your repo on Travis and others.

After everything is set up the rest of the work goes to tic. By this we mean the handling of the actual CI workflow: Which steps are going to be run, how the deployment is handled and so on.

In summary, the interaction is as follows:

  • travis: Responsible for setting up all CI related tasks and taking care of permissions.

  • tic: Responsible for the specification of the CI workflow (which stages are run, which commands are used).

To simplify setup, everything is handled by tic::use_tic(). This function requires travis to be installed manually: otherwise, each CI run would have to install travis too which is not needed otherwise.

tic is a part of . Learn more at ropensci.org.

Developed by Kirill Müller, Patrick Schratz, Mika Braginsky, Karthik Ram, Jeroen Ooms, rOpenSci. Site built by pkgdown & rotemplate.
